description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 2a). 18-19 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink. Light cream paper with laid lines visible. Fol. 187-191 are later additions. Kabīkaj and magic square and script on fol. 2a. Collation statement on the lower corner of fol. 184a (partly cut off). Several inscriptions with one obliterated ownership statement on fol. 186b (last fol. of the original ms.). Verses of poetry in Persian on fol. 187a (attributed to Saʻdī ) and 188b. Qurʼanic verses mentioning "Shifāʼ" on fol. 188a. Fol. 190 blank. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "11". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1016". According to the colophon, the al-Anwār al-Jalīyah was copied on Yawm al-Aḥad 9 Ṣafar 783 [May 5, 1381] in a Madrasah Niẓāmīyah (colophon, fol. 186a). The ms. appears however to be from a later date. Incipit text 1 (fol. 2b): كتاب الطهارات اجمعوا على ان الصلوة لا تصح الا بطهارة وجد السبيل اليها لقوله Explicit text 1 (fol. 184a): بين الامة التمسك بما اجتمع عليه ومن روى طايفة واو عصابة اراد بعض اللقة(؟) آخره والحمد لله والصلوة على محمد واله Incipit text 2 (fol. 184b): الحمد لله الذي اعطي جزيلا واولي جميلا ... قال ... عبد الرحمن بن المحسن الواسطى ... اما بعد فان اسما نبينا محمد ... كثيرة قيل هى الف اسم وانى حرصت على الوقوف عليها مجموعة Explicit text 2 (fol. 186a): منه اخذ قسم من الجمال والوسافة ... الثابت والمتيب الراجع الى الله تعالى المفكر فى قدرته تمت Beginning text 3 as extant (fol. 189a): والعفاف والغني ونعوذ بك من جهدك البلا ودرك الشقاء وسوء القصاء ... ونعوذ بك من الشر كله عاجله واجله ما علمنا منه ومن لم نعلم
author: Ibn Hubayrah, Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad, -1165
abstract: Treatise on the teaching of the different schools regarding legal questions (ikhtilāf al-madhāhib). The text is followed on fol. 184b by two short texts on wuḍūʻ, one attributed to al-Shāfiʻī, the other to al-Nawāfī(?) ; by a text on the names of the Prophet entitled according to the colophon "al-Anwār al-Jalīyah fī sharḥ asmāʼ al-Muṣṭafīyah", attributed to ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Muḥsin al-Wāsiṭī (Text 2, fol. 184b-186a) ; and by a duʻa, incomplete at beginning and end (Text 3, fol. 189a-190b).
extent: i, 191, i leaves: paper ; 222 x 157 (157 x 117) mm. bound to 222 x 157 mm.
title: Kitāb al-Ifṣāḥ ʻalá al-madhāhib al-arbaʻah
provenance: Two ownership statements on fol. 1a, signed ---? ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Dāʻī, with obliterated name of place and Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir, dated 21 Muḥarram [12]80 [July 1863]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: ابن هبيرة، يحيى بن محمد
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
binding note: Black paper over pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Violet paper pastedowns and free endleaf.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
